intro: Prostanthera chrysocalyx, commonly known as the golden calyx honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that are surrounded by colorful calyces, often in shades of yellow or orange. Its leaves are narrow and have a minty scent, contributing to its ornamental value. Prostanthera chrysocalyx is typically found in coastal regions and is adapted to well-drained soils.
